thread.title: North Korea 'fires several missiles' towards Japan but launch 'did not go off normally'
thread.title_full: North Korea 'fires several missiles' towards Japan but launch 'did not go off normally'

author: Natalie Evans
title: North Korea 'fires several missiles' towards Japan but launch 'did not go off normally'
text:
News North Korea 'fires several missiles' towards Japan but launch 'did not go off normally' Earlier this month, kim Jong-un launched four ballistic missiles and promised retaliation over US-South Korea military drills it sees as preparation for war Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Japan reacts to 'North Korean missile launch' Share this video Get politics     
North Korea is feared to have launched several missiles towards Japan on Wednesday morning. 
The launch, from the eastern area of Wonsan, may have failed, Kyodo News reported. 
It is not known what type of missiles were involved. 
Chief Cabinet Secretary Yoshihide Suga said that the government hasn't confirmed the launch and that it was always gathering and analysing information on the country. Read More North Korean military accelerates nuclear missiles programme to 'pre-emptive strike' readiness as Pyongyang issues war warning to US Kim Jong-un says he is ready for war (Photo: AFP) 
South Korea believes a the missile launch did not go off normally, the South Korean defence ministry said, adding it was conducting analysis for further details. It is thought the launch did not go off normally (Photo: AFP) 
Earlier this month, North Korea fired four ballistic missiles into the sea off Japan's northwest coast, angering South Korea and Japan. North Korea fired four ballistic missiles at Japan earlier this month (Photo: AFP) Read More 
That launch came days after Kim Jong-un promised retaliation over US-South Korea military drills it sees as preparation for war. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
